header.title: wxTreeEvent

description.p: A tree event holds information about events associated with wxTreeCtrl objects.
To process input from a tree control, use these event handler macros to direct input to member functions that take a wxTreeEvent argument.
This class is derived (and can use functions) from: wxNotifyEvent wxCommandEvent wxEvent

section.title: Events
section.p: Use wxEvtHandler:connect/3 with wxTreeEventType to subscribe to events of this type.

func.fsummary: Returns the key code if the event is a key event.

desc.p: Returns the key code if the event is a key event.
Use getKeyEvent/1 to get the values of the modifier keys for this event (i.e. Shift or Ctrl).

func.fsummary: Returns the item (valid for all events).

desc.p: Returns the item (valid for all events).

func.fsummary: Returns the key event for EVT_TREE_KEY_DOWN events.

desc.p: Returns the key event for EVT_TREE_KEY_DOWN events.

func.fsummary: Returns the label if the event is a begin or end edit label event.

desc.p: Returns the label if the event is a begin or end edit label event.

func.fsummary: Returns the old item index (valid for EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGING and EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGED events).

desc.p: Returns the old item index (valid for EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGING and EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGED events).

func.fsummary: Returns the position of the mouse pointer if the event is a drag or menu-context event.

desc.p: Returns the position of the mouse pointer if the event is a drag or menu-context event.
In both cases the position is in client coordinates - i.e. relative to the wxTreeCtrl window (so that you can pass it directly to e.g. wxWindow:popupMenu/4).

func.fsummary: Returns true if the label edit was cancelled.

desc.p: Returns true if the label edit was cancelled.
This should be called from within an EVT_TREE_END_LABEL_EDIT handler.

func.fsummary: Set the tooltip for the item (valid for EVT_TREE_ITEM_GETTOOLTIP events).

desc.p: Set the tooltip for the item (valid for EVT_TREE_ITEM_GETTOOLTIP events).
